entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 4:10PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF WITH THE HIGH TIDE FRIDAY NIGHT WEST OF THE NUSHAGAK PENINSULA... A strong Bering Sea storm will bring high surf conditions to Bristol Bay with the high tide on Friday night. The biggest impact will be west of the Nushagak Peninsula where there may be water levels 2 feet above the normal high tide line with high surf on top of

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 12:53PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Wildfire Smoke and Air Quality Impacts... * Smoke from the Mosquito wildfire continues to produce unhealthy to hazardous air quality across the region. The latest air quality observations indicate the worst conditions to be concentrated near Truckee and extending into Reno, Sparks, and the North Valleys.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Mono; Surprise Valley California

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 11:18PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Valley Fog... Clear skies, light winds and lingering low-level moisture are helping areas of valley fog to develop and become dense late tonight. entry.cap:areaDesc: Bath; Bell; Breathitt; Clay; Elliott; Estill; Fleming; Floyd; Harlan; Johnson; Knott; Knox; Lee; Leslie; Letcher; Magoffin; Martin; Menifee; Montgomery; Morgan; Owsley; Perry; Pike; Powell; Rowan; Whitley; Wolfe

entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT INTO THE MORNING HOURS... Mostly clear skies and calm conditions will lead to fog development overnight. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for a sudden reduction

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 15 at 2:22PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT PDT FRIDAY NIGHT... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory for northern Klamath and northern Lake counties... in effect through Friday, with a potential to extend the advisory through the weekend. This includes Crater Lake, Chemult, Crescent, Fort Rock, Silver Lake, and Summer Lake.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued September 15 at 11:01PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHERN SALT LAKE AND EAST CENTRAL DAVIS COUNTIES IS CANCELLED... The storms which prompted the warning have weakened below severe limits, and no longer pose an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. However gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with these thunderstorms.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 10:53PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Weber... southeastern Box Elder and northern Davis Counties through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1052 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles east of Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway to near Syracuse. Movement was northeast at 45 mph.
